An Introduction of Orbis Hong Kong cum B.titleEng: An Introduction of Orbis Hong Kong cum Briefing Session for Orbis Future Vision Leader Program 2025/26
An Introduction of Orbis Hong Kong cum B.objectives:
At the end of the programme, students will be able to:
1. Recognise the background of Orbis Hong Kong as well as the services that they are offering;
2. Understand the background, details and operation of the Orbis Future Vision Leader Program; and
3. Elevate the interest and commitment towards volunteerism.
An Introduction of Orbis Hong Kong cum B.description:
Orbis believes everyone deserves functioning eyesight regardless of their age, income or ethnic background.  To increase awareness on eye health, Orbis is now recruiting Future Vision Leader of Orbis Hong Kong, to help assimilate eyecare awareness at every level of local society.  Future Vision Leader can participate in many volunteer experiences of Orbis and will add a sense of accomplishment to one’s positive energy!  Future Vision Leader of Orbis Hong Kong may have the chance to help out with office clerical work, or using one’s creativity to influence others on the internet, or deliver eyecare talk to the community, etc. 

This Briefing Session of the Orbis Future Vision Leader Program is designed to facilitate interested parties in knowing more about the background of Orbis Hong Kong, as well as background and details of the Future Vision Leader of Orbis Hong Kong.  This session is especially suitable to students who have an initial interest in the Future Vision Leader of Orbis Hong Kong and wish to have an glimpse of the Programme before joining.

Hong Kong Red Cross Humanitarian Worksho.titleChi: 人道價值互動體驗活動: 「重寫真相」：從誤解到理解的學習體驗
Hong Kong Red Cross Humanitarian Worksho.titleEng: Hong Kong Red Cross Humanitarian Workshop: From Misunderstanding to Understanding
Hong Kong Red Cross Humanitarian Worksho.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Understand the current issues on discrimination;
2. Explore solutions to the current issues of discrimination; and 
3. Help facilitate respect for diversity in society.
Hong Kong Red Cross Humanitarian Worksho.description:
Youth as Agents of Behavioural Change (YABC) is the flagship initiative of The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) on the promotion of a culture of non-violence and peace (CNV+P). It was created in 2008 for youth and with youth from Red Cross and Red Crescent worldwide. YABC empowers them to take up an ethical leadership role in inspiring a positive transformation of mindsets, attitudes and behaviours within themselves and their community. It is built on three pillars: youth empowerment, operating from inner peace and reaching out to the community.

YABC uses non-formal peer education techniques such as games, role plays, simulation and visualization exercises, storytelling and arts. Through these activities, participants are encouraged to step out of their comfort zone, working together to learn and explore solutions to problems—all in a safe and supportive learning environment.

In this session, the thematic issue “Non-discrimination · Respect for Diversity” will be addressed through interactive means by adopting the YABC approach.

Global Inclusive Leadership Programme (C.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Embark on self-discovery values-based & purposeful leadership journey;
2. Nurture critical thinking, personal growth and self-discovery; and
3. Engage in leadership-in-action cross-disciplinary SMART AI projects.
Global Inclusive Leadership Programme (C.description:
The Global Inclusive Leadership Program aims to develop the next generation of inclusive leaders who are ethical, purpose-driven and global-minded. The program is based on a strong set of values which are the drivers in the development of character. Experience of the program encourages self-discovery and enables skills to develop which help the next generation to discover their purpose and vision. It empowers them to reach beyond their own immediate success towards significance within the local and global community. Through self-discovery, experience learning, reflective thinking and challenges, the program inspires next generation to see greater possibilities, and motivates them to pursue a purpose greater than themselves.
The platform has four cornerstones: (a) Values-based Leadership, (b) STEM+ Innovation & Big Data, (c) Arts & Culture, (d) Sustainability & Entrepreneurship, which is built upon glocal partnerships across different sectors, academia, businesses and industries. With the global diversified ecosystem that it co-create with young people across the different cultures and disciplines, it empower them from all background to unleash their potential and grow to be global leaders.

Hong Kong Hiking Trails x Leave No Trace.titleChi: 香港山徑 x 無痕山林講座
Hong Kong Hiking Trails x Leave No Trace.titleEng: Hong Kong Hiking Trails x Leave No Trace Talk
Hong Kong Hiking Trails x Leave No Trace.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Explore local hiking trails with professional sharing from experienced trekking guide;
2. Discover more about hiking responsibilities and ways to protect local nature landscapes with "Leave No Trace" global principles; and
3. Build precious connections with outdoor lovers, and be committed to preserve the nature beauty.
Hong Kong Hiking Trails x Leave No Trace.description:
How well do you know about the beauty of Hong Kong’s iconic hiking trails? Do you have any impression of hiking in Hong Kong? 

It will be an interesting and educational opportunity for you to explore deeper on the stunning hiking trails in Hong Kong. Science Unit is glad to invite professional trekker – Mr. Law Wing Fai, the founder of Oasistrek (a local hiking website) to share. In the talk, you will go through different stunning landscapes taken in the unique trails, the practical ways to build and construct trails in an eco-friendly way. You will also gain insight into the widely applied Leave No Trace principles and its importance to minimize human impacts in nature. 

The talk will be a fun one with lots of personal sharing as an experienced hiking lover. So join us and enjoy a virtual tour into the nature!

Handcrafted Trail x Green Mountaineering.titleChi: 梅子林手作步道 x 綠色山藝體驗日
Handcrafted Trail x Green Mountaineering.titleEng: Handcrafted Trail x Green Mountaineering Day @ Mui Tsz Lam
Handcrafted Trail x Green Mountaineering.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Learn about different eco-friendly trail construction techniques, including how to minimize environmental impact and preserve natural habitats;
2.  Develop a deeper appreciation for nature and understand the importance of responsible mountaineering practices; and
3.  Acquire problem-solving skills and develop connections with the nature and other like-minded students.
Handcrafted Trail x Green Mountaineering.description:
Ever wonder how a hiking trail is formed? Wish to give a hand to protect the distinctive Hong Kong nature habitats? Embark on a unique journey into nature - that blends creativity, adventure, and sustainability! 

In the workshop, you will explore deeply into eco-friendly crafts using natural materials found along the trail from experienced trainers. With hands-on guidance, you will be gaining essential mountaineering skills that prepares you to more fruitful outdoor adventures with minimized ecological footprint. 

This one-of-a-kind event is perfect for all students who love nature. For all craft lovers, and eco-conscious individuals who want to explore the great outdoors as well. Let’s protect and enjoy this unforgettable experience that celebrates the beauty of our mother planet! 
*Free boat trip between Sha Tau Kok and Mui Tsz Lam will be arranged for all participants.

Science Unit Seminar Series – Freshwater.titleChi: 科學教研組研討會系列 — 淡水生態：地球的命脈
Science Unit Seminar Series – Freshwater.titleEng: Science Unit Seminar Series – Freshwater Ecosystems: Lifeblood of Our Planet
Science Unit Seminar Series – Freshwater.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Describe three critical ecological services provided by freshwater ecosystems (e.g., water filtration, habitat provision, flood control) and their importance to human societies;
2.  Identify major anthropogenic threats to freshwater biodiversity (e.g., pollution, habitat fragmentation, climate change) and their impacts on aquatic species; and 
3. Advocate for evidence-based conservation strategies (e.g., wetland restoration, sustainable water use) to protect freshwater ecosystems in local or global contexts.
Science Unit Seminar Series – Freshwater.description: Explore rivers, lakes, and wetlands—their biodiversity, irreplaceable services, and mounting threats. Understand pollution, climate change, and habitat loss through global case studies. Discover science-backed conservation strategies to safeguard these vital ecosystems. Equip yourself to advocate for water stewardship.

Science Unit Seminar Series – Citizen Sc.titleChi: 科學教研組研討會系列 — 公民科學：如何讓學生參與真正的研究
Science Unit Seminar Series – Citizen Sc.titleEng: Science Unit Seminar Series – Citizen Science in Education: Engaging Students with Real Research
Science Unit Seminar Series – Citizen Sc.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:

1. Critique methodologies and data quality in citizen science;
2.  Learn design research questions leveraging citizen-collected data; and 
3. Analyze ethical considerations in public participation.
Science Unit Seminar Series – Citizen Sc.description: Discover how to integrate citizen science into classrooms to transform students into active researchers. This seminar equips educators with strategies for selecting projects, designing curriculum-aligned activities, and fostering critical thinking. Learn to leverage platforms like iNaturalist to ignite STEM passion while contributing to authentic global science.

Science Unit Seminar Series – From Lab t.titleChi: 科學教研組研討會系列 — 從室出發：科研為本的海洋保育
Science Unit Seminar Series – From Lab t.titleEng: Science Unit Seminar Series – From Lab to Marine: Science-Driven Conservation of the Ocean
Science Unit Seminar Series – From Lab t.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Demonstrate how lab findings on microplastic impacts (e.g., invertebrate behavior/ecophysiology) inform conservation strategies for endangered species like horseshoe crabs;
2. Highlight local case studies (e.g., Pearl River Delta pollution, juvenile horseshoe crab rehab) as models for addressing global marine threats; and 
3. Share scalable frameworks for integrating research, policy, and community engagement (e.g., citizen science, IUCN Specialist Group initiatives).
Science Unit Seminar Series – From Lab t.description: Discover how cutting-edge lab science tackles ocean crises. Dr. Cheung explores microplastic pollution’s impact on marine invertebrates and the rescue of ‘living fossils’—horseshoe crabs—in Hong Kong’s waters. Learn how his team turns data into action through conservation partnerships, policy advocacy, and public outreach, offering blueprints for global marine resilience.

Science Unit Seminar Series – Coral Symb.titleChi: 科學教研組研討會系列 — 珊瑚共生：珊瑚礁存續的秘密
Science Unit Seminar Series – Coral Symb.titleEng: Science Unit Seminar Series – Coral Symbiosis: The Secret Engine of Reef Survival
Science Unit Seminar Series – Coral Symb.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Explain the mutualistic exchange between corals and zooxanthellae (energy gain vs. shelter/nutrients);
2.  Connect coral symbiosis disruption (bleaching) to ecosystem-wide collapse for marine life/humans; and
3. Evaluate one science-based strategy to preserve reef symbioses against climate threats.
Science Unit Seminar Series – Coral Symb.description: Discover how coral-algae partnerships create biodiversity hotspots protecting coasts and feeding millions. Learn why warming oceans sever this ancient alliance—triggering bleaching and collapse. Explore cutting-edge science racing to save reefs and join the quest to defend these underwater lifelines.

Science Unit Seminar Series – Understand.titleChi: 科學教研組研討會系列 — 真理何在：如果沒有哲學，科學還可以解構世界嗎？
Science Unit Seminar Series – Understand.titleEng: Science Unit Seminar Series – Understanding Without Truth: Can Science Explain the World Without True Theories?
Science Unit Seminar Series – Understand.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1.	Distinguish Cognitive Instrumentalism; 
2.	Evaluate Probability’s Dual Role; and 
3.	Analyze False Beliefs in Progress.
Science Unit Seminar Series – Understand.description: Join renowned philosopher of science Prof. Darrell Rowbottom to challenge science’s pursuit of "truth." Discover cognitive instrumentalism—his bold thesis that science advances through predictive power and understanding, not unobservable truths. Rethink progress, probability, and realism in this provocative session.

Toastmasters Training for Public Speakin.description: The whole idea of Toastmasters Training is to develop students' English speaking skills effectively through delivering prepared and impromptu speeches in front of groups and by working with others in a supportive atmosphere. In this workshop, students will learn how to read and analyse a case, and then identify the issues or problems that need to tackle, and then propose solutions for presentation in an interview that requires the candidate to perform case analysis.

Pre-Internship Training Programme (PTP):.titleEng: Pre-Internship Training Programme (PTP): Internship Excellence: Safeguard Yourself from Employment Traps
Pre-Internship Training Programme (PTP):.objectives:

1. Raise awareness about common employment traps when applying for internships; and 
2. Establish safeguarding strategies to protect themselves from potential exploitations or harm in the workplace.
Pre-Internship Training Programme (PTP):.description:
As a compulsory component of the Pre-Internship Training Programme (PTP), this is one of the pre-requisites for students who are applying for internship programmes and/or internship subsidies arranged by OSA to participate in an internship programme.  

Students may face difficult challenges and employment traps when applying for or entering internships.  These traps can be costly financially, emotionally, or physically to students' wellbeing.  This workshop will cover different employment traps and highlight students' awareness on these potential traps.  Through this workshop, students will be equipped with strategies to safeguard themselves from potential exploitations or harm in the workplace.

Pre-Internship Training Programme (PTP):.titleEng: Pre-Internship Training Programme (PTP): Internship Excellence: Work Ethics and Integrity
Pre-Internship Training Programme (PTP):.description:
As a compulsory component of the Pre-Internship Training Programme (PTP), this is one of the pre-requisites for students who are applying for internship programmes and/or internship subsidies arranged by OSA to participate in an internship programme. 

In this workshop, students will learn the importance of work ethics and integrity in the workplace setting.  Through case studies, experience sharing and fictive scenarios, students will be guided to develop their professional judgement, ethical mindset, professional behaviour and accountability in the workplace.

AI Tools Mastery Workshop: Practical Ski.titleChi: AI 實用工具工作坊 - 提升學習與工作效率的必備技能
AI Tools Mastery Workshop: Practical Ski.titleEng: AI Tools Mastery Workshop: Practical Skills for Study and Work
AI Tools Mastery Workshop: Practical Ski.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Leverage the transformative potential of generative AI tools;
2.  Research, study, and write more effectively by adopting the mindset and skills required; and
3. Create eye-catching visuals, presentations, job applications and task automation.
AI Tools Mastery Workshop: Practical Ski.description:
This AI Tools Mastery Workshop cover four practical topics that help students harness the power of AI tools:

1. Get Started with Generative AI - Explore the fundamentals of generative AI, including how it works, its strengths and limitations, and practical skills like prompt engineering. Develop a strong foundation and the mindset to effectively use AI tools in real-world scenarios.

2. Studying with Generative AI - Discover how to use AI to research, learn, and write more efficiently. Learn to use AI to boost academic productivity while maintaining a balance to ensure the personal growth isn’t compromised.

3. Producing Creative Content with Generative AI - Harness the power of AI to produce stunning visuals, engaging presentations, and creative assets such as songs and videos, bringing your ideas to life effortlessly.

4. Leveraging Generative AI for Career Success - Learn how AI can support your career development, from identifying career paths to crafting impactful CV and cover letters, and preparing for interviews. Discover how AI can automate repetitive tasks and perform data analysis and visualization.

2. Engage in a guided art-making experience to reflect on their inner state and gain personal insights through visual expression; and

Regulate with Art: An Experiential Works.description: This 90-minute online experiential workshop introduces students to the core ideas of art and well-being, with a focus on emotional regulation and self-awareness. Together, we will also consider ways to build small, creative routines into daily life as a means of nurturing emotional health.

Participants will identify common university stressors and learn effective stress management techniques, such as mindfulness, relaxation exercises, and time prioritization. The session will guide students in developing personalized strategies to balance academic responsibilities with self-care, while building resilience and coping skills to navigate university life with confidence and clarity.

Cultivating Happiness in University Life.description: This workshop is designed to help students understand the concept of happiness and its relevance to their university experience. Participants will explore key factors that contribute to long-term happiness, such as emotional balance, gratitude, and purpose, while learning practical strategies to build positive habits, manage stress, and enhance overall well-being. The session will also focus on fostering meaningful relationships and creating a supportive social environment, empowering students to develop an actionable plan for sustaining happiness and fulfillment during their university journey and beyond.

Overcoming Imposter Syndrome: Embrace Yo.description: This workshop aims to help participants understand the concept of imposter syndrome and recognize its impact on their personal and professional lives. Participants will identify the root causes of self-doubt, learn evidence-based strategies to build confidence and combat negative self-talk, and develop a positive, self-affirming mindset. Practical tools will be provided to help sustain long-term self-assurance and resilience in overcoming challenges.

Level Up Your Learning: Essential Study.titleChi: 學習技巧 Level Up︰學成功必備學習策略
Level Up Your Learning: Essential Study.titleEng: Level Up Your Learning: Essential Study Strategies for University Success
Level Up Your Learning: Essential Study.description: This talk will present various study strategies for university students. Participants will learn techniques such as active recall, spaced repetition, and the Pomodoro technique. Emphasis will be placed on recognizing individual learning styles and creating optimal study environments. Additionally, students will develop personalized study plans to effectively manage their academic workload.

Ace the Test: Ultimate Exam Prep Worksho.titleChi: 滿分解碼︰大學生考試準備終極指南
Ace the Test: Ultimate Exam Prep Worksho.titleEng: Ace the Test: Ultimate Exam Prep Workshop for University Success
Ace the Test: Ultimate Exam Prep Worksho.description: This talk will provide essential strategies for exam preparation and performance. It will cover various exam formats and specific tactics for each. Participants will learn about creating effective revision plans, incorporating practice exams, and stress management techniques. By the end, students will have a set of strategies to enhance their exam readiness and confidence.

Stress-Proof 101: Level Up Your Resilien.titleChi: 抗壓101︰升級你的韌性超能力
Stress-Proof 101: Level Up Your Resilien.titleEng: Stress-Proof 101: Level Up Your Resilience Superpowers
Stress-Proof 101: Level Up Your Resilien.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1.Explore how chronic stress impacts mental health (e.g., anxiety, emotional exhaustion) and weakens resilience.
2.Develop self-compassion practices to counter negative self-talk and build emotional resilience during setbacks.
3.Discover how physical habits (nutrition, movement, sleep) directly support mental health and prevent burnout.
4.Apply mindfulness and grounding techniques to regulate overwhelming emotions and recharge mental energy.
5.Design a sustainable self-care routine that prioritizes mental well-being alongside academic and social goals.
Stress-Proof 101: Level Up Your Resilien.description: This talk provides essential strategies for managing stress and enhancing resilience, covering the impacts of chronic stress on mental health (like anxiety and exhaustion) and practical self-care techniques; participants will learn to develop self-compassion to counter negative self-talk, incorporate physical habits such as nutrition, movement, and sleep to prevent burnout, apply mindfulness and grounding for emotional regulation, and design sustainable routines that balance well-being with academic and social goals.

Snooze & Thrive: Crack the Code to Bette.titleChi: 安睡秘訣︰破解睡眠升級法﹙不靠褪黑激素！﹚
Snooze & Thrive: Crack the Code to Bette.titleEng: Snooze & Thrive: Crack the Code to Better Sleep (No Melatonin Required!)
Snooze & Thrive: Crack the Code to Bette.description: This talk provides strategies for improving sleep and enhancing well-being, covering the science of sleep and its impact on academic performance and mental health. Participants will learn to identify sleep disruptors like screen time, caffeine, and learn what revenge bedtime procrastination is. By the end, students can adopt practical  techniques to enhance their sleep quality.

Stress Relief Tips: Learning Resilience.titleChi: 脫壓秘笈︰從復元故事中學習壓力管理
Stress Relief Tips: Learning Resilience.titleEng: Stress Relief Tips: Learning Resilience from Stories of Recovery
Stress Relief Tips: Learning Resilience.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Identify the signs and symptoms of stress and understand its impact on their mental and physical health; and
2. Learn from real-life stories of recovery to discover key resilience strategies and coping mechanisms; and
3. Apply various stress relief techniques in their daily lives to manage stress effectively.
Stress Relief Tips: Learning Resilience.description: In this talk, students will learn how to recognize the signs of stress and understand its effects on their mental and physical health. Through inspiring real-life stories and practical tips, the session highlights how resilience can be built over time. Students will also be introduced to simple, effective techniques they can use every day to manage stress and stay balanced.

instructor.name: Tin Hang YAM

Strategies to Free Yourself from Self-Do.titleEng: Strategies to Free Yourself from Self-Doubt
Strategies to Free Yourself from Self-Do.description:
Do you often feel anxious, lack confidence, or think, “I’m not good enough”? These are signs of self-doubt—a silent force that holds you back from connecting with others and reaching your full potential.                                                                        
                                                                                                        In this talk, we’ll explore how Compassion Focused Therapy and Neuroscience can help you understand and overcome self-doubt. You’ll learn how it affects your emotions and well-being, and discover practical tools to build self-compassion and confidence.

Understanding Self-Worth Through Online.titleEng: Understanding Self-Worth Through Online Social Interaction
Understanding Self-Worth Through Online.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Identify positive and negative aspects of online social interactions and their effects on mental health; and
2. Develop strategies to maintain a healthy self-image and self-worth in the context of online social media; and
3. Reflect on their own experiences with online social interactions and how these have shaped their perception of self-worth.
Understanding Self-Worth Through Online.description: In today’s digital world, online social interactions play a big role in shaping how we see ourselves. This workshop helps students explore both the positive and negative sides of social media and how it can affect mental health and self-worth. Through guided reflection and activities, students will learn how to build a healthy self-image, set boundaries, and better understand their own experiences in the online space.

Health Talk: Introduction to nutrition f.objectives: At the end of the course, students are able to have a basic understanding of the nutritional content of a nutrition facts labels on the back of food packaging.
Health Talk: Introduction to nutrition f.description: Nutrition facts labels, often found on the back of food packaging, provide a standardised way to understand the nutritional content of a product. They break down the amounts of calories, macronutrients (like fats, carbohydrates, and proteins), and micronutrients (vitamins and minerals) per serving. This information empowers consumers to make informed choices about their food intake and dietary needs.

Culinary Aesthetics - Exploring Life Thr.titleEng: Culinary Aesthetics - Exploring Life Through Hong Kong's Food Culture
Culinary Aesthetics - Exploring Life Thr.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Gain insights into the principles of culinary aesthetics in Hong Kong; and
2. Learn about the historical and cultural contexts that shape Hong Kong's diverse food scene.
Culinary Aesthetics - Exploring Life Thr.description: This programme designed to provide insights into the principles of culinary aesthetics while exploring the rich historical and cultural contexts that shape Hong Kong's diverse food scene. Participants will delve into the artistry behind food preparation and presentation, understanding the intricate connections between culinary practices and personal narratives. Through expert insights and immersive dining experiences, students will gain a deeper appreciation for the significance of food in Hong Kong's culture. This programme invites participants to experience the vibrant tapestry of traditions, and stories that define this unique culinary landscape.

Participants will gain insights into the artistry that has shaped Hong Kong's visual culture, celebrating the enduring legacy of applied calligraphy.

Cantonese Narrative Singing
“Meet the Hong Kong Maestro”: Music of.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Develop an understanding of the historical and cultural significance of traditional Chinese theatre and Cantonese narrative singing; 
2.  Gain practical skills in performing traditional Chinese music and operatic techniques through hands-on training; and
3. Explore the relationship between music, storytelling, and cultural identity in the context of Hong Kong’s artistic heritage.
“Meet the Hong Kong Maestro”: Music of.description: This short-term training offers an immersive exploration of traditional Chinese theatre music and Cantonese narrative singing. Led by the renowned group The Gong Strikes One, students will engage in hands-on training, learning about the rich history and performance practices of "naamyam" and Chinese music performances. This programme combines practical skills with cultural insights, allowing students to appreciate and perform traditional pieces while understanding their significance within Hong Kong’s vibrant artistic landscape. By fostering a deeper understanding of these art forms, the programme seeks to promote the music of traditional Chinese theatre and support the ongoing inheritance of traditional Cantonese narrative singing, emphasising its importance beyond mere recreational interest.
“Meet the Hong Kong Maestro”: Music of.remarks: Participants will be expected to sing as part of the workshop. No professional experience is required, but a willingness to engage in music exercises is essential.

2. Learn about the historical context and cultural significance in local arts; and
3. Develop a deeper appreciation for the artistry and creativity involved in paper crafting, recognising its role in preserving Hong Kong's cultural heritage.
“Meet the Hong Kong Maestro”: \nSharing.description: Participate in the“Meet the Hong Kong Maestro” Series for a two-hour seminar featuring Mr. Kenneth MO, Hong Kong's foremost paper craft master and esteemed Chairman of the Hong Kong Traditional Paper Crafting Arts Union. This engaging session will provide insights into traditional paper crafting techniques, exploring their historical context and cultural significance within local arts. Participants will learn about the role of paper craft in traditional social practices, rituals, and festive events in Hong Kong. Mr. MO will showcase and demonstrate the intricate processes involved in creating paper artworks, fostering a deeper appreciation for this vital aspect of Hong Kong's cultural heritage.

Theatre Aesthetic: Explore the World fro.description: This dynamic two-part course led by the artistic director of Theatre Ronin, a company celebrated for its innovative approach and recipient of the Hong Kong Arts Development Council’s three-year grant. The first lesson features an interactive workshop where students will engage in games and practical examples to delve into the aesthetics of ‘Theatre of Imagery’ and create a distinctively imaginative performing style. This experience aims to cultivate our creative potential and elevate our imaginative capabilities. The second lesson is a lecture that introduces the evolution of theatrical aesthetics across cultures and time. This programme has been featured in fringe activities at various overseas arts festivals, inspiring theatre lovers and fostering a deeper appreciation for the art forms.

Film Screening: A Land Imagined (2018),.titleEng: Film Screening: A Land Imagined (2018), Directed by Yeo Siew Hua
Film Screening: A Land Imagined (2018),.description:
The film screening session features the Singaporean film A Land Imagined (2018), which follows police investigators as they delve into two missing persons cases at a land reclamation site in Singapore. As the mystery unfolds, the film offers a haunting portrayal of migrant workers' lives and reveals the exploitative dynamics underneath such large-scale infrastructure development.

After the screening, invited speakers will share insights on ecocriticism from a cultural studies perspective, using the film as an entry point. We will then open the floor to students for more conversation on the socio-environmental ramifications of land reclamation—exploring its impact on social life, its entanglement with the exploitation of peripheral economies, and its role in reshaping ecological and social balances.

2. Breaking Out of Your Comfort Zone: Taking Action and Forming Habits,The Habit Loop and Behavioral Change,Enhancing Motivation and Execution Ability; and 
3. Blueprint for a Fulfilling Life: Integration and Practice, Personal Vision Board Design, Long-Term Happiness Strategies.
Mindfulness: Build Your Dream.description: Without realisation, we often encounter a lot of stress, emotions, and even negative effects such as negative thinking in our everyday life. In order to help students establish more positive values and overcome future challenges, the activity allows students to gain first-hand experience in building a solid foundation for their physical and mental health.

Lonely Planet: A Solitary Journey Throug.titleChi: 孤獨星球：在中亞當背包客
Lonely Planet: A Solitary Journey Throug.titleEng: Lonely Planet: A Solitary Journey Through Central Asia
Lonely Planet: A Solitary Journey Throug.description: This talk explores the diverse landscapes and cultures of Central Asia through a solo backpacker's lens. Experience Kazakhstan's vast wilderness, Uzbekistan's magnificent Silk Road heritage, and Turkmenistan's surreal natural and urban landscapes. Gain practical insights into regional travel logistics, cultural nuances, and off-the-beaten-path adventures across these fascinating yet often overlooked destinations.

The \"Werewolf Game\" Theory.objectives:

1. Understand the general concept, basic psychological knowledge, and strategies of the game (such as logic and counter logic); and
2. Improve teamwork, critical thinking, and communication skills.
The \"Werewolf Game\" Theory.description: The "Werewolf Game" is a multi-player strategy board game that uses language description to promote and compete on eloquence and analytical judgement. Residents will learn how to use rigorous logical thinking in the game to find loopholes in their opponents.
The \"Werewolf Game\" Theory.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Welcome Party for Non-local Residents.objectives:
At the end of the activity, residents will be able to:

2. Meet Warden, Senior Tutor and Tutors; and
3. Collect information on hostel activities and facilities.
Welcome Party for Non-local Residents.description: Hostel life is being an important, cherish moment for students. Through meeting with warden, students could get more information of hostel culture through the prenstation given by the Warden Office, as well as QA sessions.

Also, from using the upcycled materials, students can learn the concept of recycling thorigh actual practice.

Mid-Autumn Festival Lantern Workshop.objectives:

Meeting with Warden.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Know about upcoming activities, community guidelines, and available support services through a virtual briefing led by the warden.
Meeting with Warden.description: This online session provides a comprehensive overview of hostel life, including planned events, behavioral expectations, and the resources available to support residents' well-being. Hosted via Zoom, the warden will walk participants through key rules, answer questions, and introduce staff members who can assist with various needs. It’s a welcoming space for new and returning residents to stay informed, feel connected, and understand how to make the most of their hostel experience.

Painting Workshop: Water Colour Painting.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Introduce participants to the expressive and meditative art of watercolor painting; and 
2. Develop foundational techniques and personal artistic style.
Painting Workshop: Water Colour Painting.description: This workshop invites you into the fluid and vibrant world of watercolor. Whether you're a complete beginner or someone looking to refine your brushwork, you'll explore essential techniques like wet-on-wet blending, layering, and color mixing. Guided by an experienced instructor, participants will create their own watercolor pieces while learning how to control water flow, pigment intensity, and brush movement. The session emphasizes creativity, relaxation, and self-expression—making it perfect for anyone seeking a mindful artistic escape.
Painting Workshop: Water Colour Painting.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

3D Print Workshop: Basic 3D Modelling &.titleChi: 3D列印工作坊：基礎建模與列印
3D Print Workshop: Basic 3D Modelling &.titleEng: 3D Print Workshop: Basic 3D Modelling & Printing Workshop
3D Print Workshop: Basic 3D Modelling &.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Introduce participants to the fundamentals of 3D modeling and printing; and 
2. Empowering participants to design and produce their own simple 3D objects using accessible tools and techniques.
3D Print Workshop: Basic 3D Modelling &.description: This hands-on workshop is perfect for beginners curious about the world of 3D printing. Participants will learn how to create basic digital models using user-friendly software like Nomad, and understand how these designs are transformed into physical objects through additive manufacturing. The session covers key concepts such as slicing, printer setup, material selection, and troubleshooting. By the end, each participant will have designed and printed a small object—bringing their digital idea to life. No prior experience required—just imagination and a willingness to learn!
3D Print Workshop: Basic 3D Modelling &.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Camera in Any Form: Make Your Own Pinhol.titleEng: Camera in Any Form: Make Your Own Pinhole Camera Workshop
Camera in Any Form: Make Your Own Pinhol.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Introduce participants to the fundamentals of photography by guiding them through the hands-on creation of a functional pinhole camera using everyday materials.
Camera in Any Form: Make Your Own Pinhol.description: This workshop invites you to step back into the origins of photography and build your own pinhole camera from scratch. Using simple tools like cardboard, aluminum foil, and black tape, participants will learn how light, shadow, and exposure come together to form an image—without any lenses or electronics. Alongside the crafting process, you'll explore the physics of light and image formation, then test your camera in real-world conditions. It’s a creative, educational experience perfect for curious minds, DIY enthusiasts, and anyone who loves blending art with science.
Camera in Any Form: Make Your Own Pinhol.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

PSC Pronunciation Intensive Workshop: B.titleEng: PSC Pronunciation Intensive Workshop:  Boost Your Score, Speak with Confidence!
PSC Pronunciation Intensive Workshop: B.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Enhance participants' Madarin pronunciation and speaking clarity; and
2.  Communicate confidently and effectively in academic or examination settings.
PSC Pronunciation Intensive Workshop: B.description: This intensive workshop is designed for learners who want to refine their Mandarin pronunciation. Through focused training on tones, phonetic articulation, and speech rhythm, participants will learn to correct common pronunciation mistakes and speak more clearly and naturally. The session includes interactive exercises, personalized feedback, and practical speaking drills to boost confidence and fluency. Whether you're preparing for exams, interviews, or simply want to sound more native, this workshop offers the tools to elevate your Mandarin speaking skills.
PSC Pronunciation Intensive Workshop: B.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Movie Appreciation: Aquaman.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Understand the current water pollution situation;
2. Gain interest in the life below water; and
3. Release stress and take a break from the study through movie appreciation.
Movie Appreciation: Aquaman.description: Movie appreciation is one of the best ways to create resonance with audience. “Aquaman” is a movie about the underwater world, highlighting the power struggle between authorities in destroying the surface world for polluting the ocean. Through this movie appreciation activity, we hope to underscore the importance and our roles in protecting the natural world and promote the sustainability efforts.

AI x Latte Art Coffee Workshop.titleChi: AI x 咖啡拉花工作坊
AI x Latte Art Coffee Workshop.titleEng: AI x Latte Art Coffee Workshop
AI x Latte Art Coffee Workshop.objectives:
At the end of the workshop, students will be able to:
1. Learn about different types of coffee and various flavour profiles;
2. Acquire hands-on experience in using AI tools and technologies to create latte art designs; and
3. Explore how AI can inspire new forms of creativity and innovation in the traditional art of coffee making.
AI x Latte Art Coffee Workshop.description: AI x Coffee Time@Lingnan! Calling for young coffee enthusiasts to explore the innovative blend of specialty coffee and intricate art of latte designs through AI demostration. This hands-on workshop merges new technology with latte art, preparing students for a future where digitalisation and tradition intersect in creative ways.
AI x Latte Art Coffee Workshop.remarks:
Open to ALL
Sessions 1 and 2 are with the same content. Students may choose to enrol in EITHER session.

Please bring along and present your Student ID Card for access to the Learning Commons.

Your Dream Life: Music and Photo Therapy.titleChi: 夢與想：音樂及照片療癒工作坊
Your Dream Life: Music and Photo Therapy.titleEng: Your Dream Life: Music and Photo Therapy Workshop
Your Dream Life: Music and Photo Therapy.objectives:
At the end of the workshop, students will be able to:
1. Enhance their imagination and ways of expression;
2. Strengthen interpersonal communication and social interaction; and
3. Appreciate what oneself and others think.
Your Dream Life: Music and Photo Therapy.description: Music and photography makes a good personal growth journey, broadening your perspectives and expanding your thinking space. This workshop uses a powerful tool Points of You to train students’ ability to integrate photo therapy and music therapy, and explore their inner world by sharing ideas and expressing them to others.

Let's Dance: Jive.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Gain basic knowledge about different types of social dance;
2. Enjoy various social dance music genres; and
3. Dance with basic jive steps to the music.
Let's Dance: Jive.description: The jive is lively and fast-paced African-American dance that is usually danced to up-beat music with energetic tempo. This exciting activity engages students in the basic jive steps and associated music genres. Students can also enhance their physical and mental well-being through body stretching and making friends with dance partners.

Christmas Handcraft Workshop.objectives:
At the end of the workshop, students will be able to:
1. Unleash their creativity and design unique Christmas decorations, fostering their artistic skills;
2. Learn new crafting techniques; and
3. Communicate with others and exchange ideas on cultural celebrations.
Christmas Handcraft Workshop.description: Merry Christmas! This workshop offers a festive space for creative handcrafts. Participants engage in holiday-themed crafts, fostering a sense of community and spreading seasonal cheer and warmth.
Christmas Handcraft Workshop.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Self-Understanding: Personality Dimensio.titleChi: 自我認識：性格透視工作坊
Self-Understanding: Personality Dimensio.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Know about your personality preference from a personality assessment;
2. Appreciate and embrace the personality differences and uniqueness among different students; and 
3. Reflect on and respond to the multi-cultural environment of the hostel community.
Self-Understanding: Personality Dimensio.description: This workshop will give students a basic introduction to personality preferences from a personality assessment. Students will learn about the uniqueness of different dimensions and their communication styles, including Inquiring Green, Resourceful Orange, Organized Gold, and Authentic Blue. Some practical tips to facilitate students to appreciate different people around the Lingnan campus will be shared.

Cultivating Your Aesthetic: A Photograph.titleChi: 培養個人美感：攝影與藝術構圖工作坊
Cultivating Your Aesthetic: A Photograph.titleEng: Cultivating Your Aesthetic: A Photography and Art Composition Workshop
Cultivating Your Aesthetic: A Photograph.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Understand the concept of aesthetic development through photography.
2. Apply foundational composition techniques in portrait and still life photography; and
3. Explore influences from other art fields, such as painting and graphic design, to develop their own visual identity and artistic voice.
Cultivating Your Aesthetic: A Photograph.description: In this workshop, a local artist will guide participants through practical and artistic ways to cultivate their personal aesthetic.  Through the lens of portrait and still life photography, the session introduces basic composition techniques while also exploring the intersection of photography with other art forms.  Participants will be inspired by iconic works and photographers and will reflect on how to develop their own visual taste and creative approach.
Cultivating Your Aesthetic: A Photograph.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Tales of Solo Travel and Couchsurfing.titleChi: 獨遊和沙發衝浪的故事
Tales of Solo Travel and Couchsurfing.titleEng: Tales of Solo Travel and Couchsurfing
Tales of Solo Travel and Couchsurfing.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:

1. Acquire skills to effectively plan their own couchsurfing and solo trips, including how to select the right host;
2. Understand safety protocols and best practices for couchsurfing, ensuring a secure and enjoyable travel experience; and
3. Develop cultural awareness and communication skills necessary for engaging with hosts and locals during their travels.
Tales of Solo Travel and Couchsurfing.description: Is couchsurfing safe? Are you considering a solo trip but feeling hesitant? In this sharing session, a passionate traveler who loves solo trips and couchsurfing will share his experiences. You’ll discover why couchsurfing might be the best way to travel! Additionally, you'll acquire the skills to plan your own solo or couchsurfing adventure. Join us to see the world!

Career Café - Dialogue with Pioneers in.titleEng: Career Café - Dialogue with Pioneers in Different Fields
Career Café - Dialogue with Pioneers in.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Expand their awareness of diverse career pathways;
2. Learn how to prepare for personal development during their university years; and
3. Foster authentic professional connections.
Career Café - Dialogue with Pioneers in.description: This workshop will feature guests from diverse backgrounds, representing a wide range of fields including scientific research, technology entrepreneurship, social enterprise, sustainable development, education, culture, and the arts.  This varied panel will offer participants a rich perspective on different career paths and the intersections between disciplines, fostering meaningful discussions and valuable insights.
Career Café - Dialogue with Pioneers in.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Food and Knowledge Production.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Understand how food is being massively produced in our society;
2. Reconsider how cultural knowledge reflects an alternative attitude towards human, nature and food; and
3. Explore ways of being environmentally friendly
Food and Knowledge Production.description: This workshop invites students to have a taste on produce grown and harvested in two different systems, which is later ensued by a discussion on how food is produced, positioned and branded in contemporary world.
Food and Knowledge Production.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Workshop on Sleep Hygiene to Help You Sl.titleChi: 一夜好眠小撇步 - 睡眠衛生工作坊
Workshop on Sleep Hygiene to Help You Sl.titleEng: Workshop on Sleep Hygiene to Help You Sleep Better
Workshop on Sleep Hygiene to Help You Sl.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Learn the importance of sleep hygiene;
2. Review their sleeping and living habits; and
3. Apply sleep hygiene tips to reduce insomnia.
Workshop on Sleep Hygiene to Help You Sl.description: The speaker will introduce the basics of sleep hygiene, conduct individual sleep hygiene review, and provide useful tips to help you sleep better.
Workshop on Sleep Hygiene to Help You Sl.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Group Fitness Exploration on Lingnan Cam.titleChi: 嶺大團體健身園地探索工作坊
Group Fitness Exploration on Lingnan Cam.titleEng: Group Fitness Exploration on Lingnan Campus
Group Fitness Exploration on Lingnan Cam.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:

1. Explore the fitness facilities available at the Pan Sutong Sports Ground;
2. Practice street workouts for fitness; and
3. Develop a healthy lifestyle through regular exercise.
Group Fitness Exploration on Lingnan Cam.description:
Let’s explore the outdoor fitness area on our beautiful Lingnan campus. Students will delve into the fundamentals of outdoor fitness training, highlighting key safety guidelines and principles. Participants will actively engage in street workouts tailored for fitness, allowing them to practice effective exercise techniques in a supportive environment and empowering them with the knowledge and skills to foster a healthy lifestyle that incorporates regular exercise into their daily routines. Please join us at the Pan Sutong Sports Ground's Outdoor Fitness Area to explore the facilities and engage in fun, collaborative exercises. 
(The event is co-organized with the Sports Coaching and Event Management programme)

sessions.venue: Pan Sutong Sports Ground Outdoor Fitness Area

Declutter Your Life: A Minimalist Journe.titleEng: Declutter Your Life: A Minimalist Journey
Declutter Your Life: A Minimalist Journe.objectives:
At the end of the activity, students will be able to:
1. Understand the principles of decluttering and minimalism;
2. Identify personal items and commitments that contribute to their stress; and
3. Develop actionable strategies to create a more organised and fulfilling living space.
Declutter Your Life: A Minimalist Journe.description: Join us for an engaging one-hour session on "Declutter Your Life: A Minimalist Journey". This workshop is designed for university students living in hostels and focuses on the transformative power of decluttering. Discover how simplifying your space can lead to reduced stress, increased productivity, and a more mindful lifestyle. Together, we will explore practical techniques and share tips to help you embrace minimalism and enhance your daily life. Don't miss this opportunity to start your journey toward a more organized and fulfilling existence!

Declutter Your Life: A Minimalist Journe.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Tips for Living Peacefully with Your Roo.titleChi: 與室友和平共處的技巧
Tips for Living Peacefully with Your Roo.titleEng: Tips for Living Peacefully with Your Roommate
Tips for Living Peacefully with Your Roo.objectives:
At the end of the workshop, students will be able to: 
1. Learn good hostel manners; 
2. Learn to discuss with roommates to understand each other's expectation for peaceful living; and 
3. Go through some past cases to learn the technique to resolve conflicts.
Tips for Living Peacefully with Your Roo.description: Participants will listen to the tutor's presentation to learn about the missions of WJY, the hostel room and the wash room etiquette, common causes and possible solutions of conflicts, and some past cases. At the end, students are welcome to share their own cases and have a fruitful discussion.
Tips for Living Peacefully with Your Roo.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Methods and Practices of AI-Assisted Sci.titleChi: AI輔助科學解夢的方法與實踐
Methods and Practices of AI-Assisted Sci.titleEng: Methods and Practices of AI-Assisted Scientific Dream Interpretation
Methods and Practices of AI-Assisted Sci.objectives:
At the end of the workshop, students will be able to:
1. Understand the intrinsic connections between dreams, the subconscious, and emotional states; 
2. Gain insight into personal psychological needs through common dreams; and 
3. Learn to use AI to assist in scientific dream interpretation.
Methods and Practices of AI-Assisted Sci.description: This workshop explores the universal psychological symbols of common dreams (such as falling, flying, and being chased) and explains their associations with stress, anxiety, and unmet needs. Through case studies, it illustrates how recurrent dreams may reflect psychological distress and emphasizes the supportive value of scientific dream interpretation for self-awareness and psychological adjustment. It will also demonstrate how to use AI tools to assist in dream interpretation, fostering self-awareness and healing.
Methods and Practices of AI-Assisted Sci.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Sharing More about My Home Country.titleEng: Sharing More about My Home Country
Sharing More about My Home Country.objectives:
At the end of the workshop, after sharing by exchange students with interaction from local students, exchange and local students will be able to: 
1. Further understand each of their cultures; 
2. Better appreciate their own background; and
3. Build deeper connection with each other.
Sharing More about My Home Country.description: As ice-breaker, non-local participants will take turn to share their countries' key features. The local participants will then ask question(s) for the non-local participants to answer, while the non-local participants will also ask question(s) for the local participants to answer. Such dialogue would enhance understanding of each of their cultures which result in better appreciation of their own backgrounds and deeper connection with each other.
Sharing More about My Home Country.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Cinema Appreciation Night.objectives:
At the end of the workshop, students will be able to:
1. To appreciate and attempt deep dive at a cinematic artwork; 
2. Learning more about stage directions, how the story interacts with the audience and how directors make the artwork "self-aware"; and 
3. Participate in cultural exchanges and discuss reflections with other hostel residents.
Cinema Appreciation Night.description: Watching a short episode of Black Mirror, then participants will discuss the meaning behind the film and its philosophical significance.
Cinema Appreciation Night.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

Natural Plant Dyeing Workshop.objectives:
At the end of the workshop, students will be able to:
1. Gain a comprehensive understanding of natural plant-based dyes as well as dyes derived from everyday food waste; and 
2.  Explore the environmental benefits of using sustainable, zero-waste dyeing techniques and learn practical skills to create their own eco-friendly dyed bag from common natural materials.
Natural Plant Dyeing Workshop.description:
In this interactive and creative workshop, you will get hands-on experience with the art of dyeing using natural plants and food waste. Discover how everyday scraps that you might usually throw away can be transformed into vibrant, eco-friendly dyes. Through fun, practical activities, you will learn sustainable techniques that not only reduce waste but also show the beauty of nature’s colors. This is a unique chance to reconnect with natural materials, sharpen your crafting skills, and reconsider the value of what we often discard—turning trash into treasure with color!

If you want it to be more formal, casual, or detailed, just let me know!

Hiking around Lingnan.description: We will start at Lingnan and have a fun hike in the morning to the Lam Tei Reservoir. This session aims to provide students with an opportunity to interact with the nature around us.
Hiking around Lingnan.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL

In Books, We Meet.titleChi: 書海相遇: 書本交流 X 手造書小節
In Books, We Meet.objectives:
At the end of the workshop, students will be able to:
1. Establish reading habit with interaction; 
2. Create friendships and connections with books; and 
3. Participate in cultural exchange and enjoy post-reading reflections with other hostel residents.
In Books, We Meet.description:
How often do you read books? Are there meaningful and memorable quotes from books that support your life and moral values as a person?  

In this session, you will bring a book that represents you, or that you have learnt a great lesson, to attend. After peer discussion on the chosen book, you will share a fun night making your own reading-journal-like scrap book. Books are wonderful languages that go beyond any differences in background – and at this night we will make it a fun one with book exchange, handcrafts and chat.  

Come and celebrate your own reading journey!
In Books, We Meet.remarks: Residents FIRST, then open to ALL
